title: How to Make Rainbow Sheep in Minecraft (All Versions & Platforms)

steps.title: Find a sheep.
steps.content: Find a sheep. If you don’t already have a sheep, you can look for any color of sheep in the forest and plains biomes. [1] X Research source If you're having a hard time finding sheep, you can summon them using this cheat in the console: /summon sheep [spawnPos] .

steps.title: Transport the sheep to your farm.
steps.content: Transport the sheep to your farm. Lure them to an enclosed area of your farm with wheat and they'll happily follow you through the gate. [2] X Research source If you prefer, you can transport the sheep in a boat. For instance, build a fence and add a gate to create an enclosed space to keep your sheep.

steps.title: Find a name tag.
steps.content: Find a name tag. Unfortunately, you can’t make name tags—you have to find them around the world. There are three common ways to get a name tag: [3] X Research source Loot chests: Name tags can be found inside chests in dungeons, abandoned mineshafts, woodland mansions, and Nether Fortresses. [4] X Research source Fishing: Each time you catch a fish , it has a 0.8% chance of being a name tag. [5] X Research source With the Luck of the Sea enchantment on your fishing rod, the probability rate increases to 1.9%. Trading with a librarian: Complete lower-tier trades with a librarian until you've unlocked the 6th tier (Master). At that point, you can buy a name tag for 20 to 22 emeralds . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Fire up an anvil.
steps.content: Fire up an anvil. If you don’t already have one, craft your own anvil . Then, stand in front of it and click it. This opens the “Repair & Name” menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Move the name tag to the first box inside the anvil.
steps.content: Move the name tag to the first box inside the anvil. This is the box to the left of the plus (+) sign. Simply drag the name tag from your inventory to this box. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Type jeb_ into the "Name Tag" field.
steps.content: Type jeb_ into the "Name Tag" field. The “Name Tag” field is the brown box at the top of the “Repair & Name” menu. Simply type “jeb_” into the field. A name tag called "jeb_" will then appear in the third box (after the arrow). [9] X Research source Do not forget the underscore . If you do, the sheep won't turn rainbow.

steps.title: Move the name tag to the inventory hotbar.
steps.content: Move the name tag to the inventory hotbar. Drag the “jeb_” name tag down to the bottom row to add it back to your inventory. Renaming the tag will cost 1 experience level. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click the sheep while holding the name tag.
steps.content: Right-click the sheep while holding the name tag. This adds the name tag to the sheep. Now that the sheep is named jeb_ , it will start cycling through the Minecraft color spectrum. [11] X Research source

steps.title: The sheep’s wool will be its original color, not rainbow.
steps.content: The sheep’s wool will be its original color, not rainbow. Unfortunately, it’s not possible to get rainbow colored wool. When you shear a “jeb_” sheep, its wool will be its original color. For instance, if the sheep was originally white, its wool will be white. [12] X Research source If you sheared the sheep, let it graze in some grass to bring back its shimmering rainbow wool. You also can’t breed rainbow sheep—the only way to get a rainbow sheep is to name it “jeb_”. Any baby sheep you breed from rainbow sheep will be the original color of one of their parents. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Use the name tag on other mobs for other fun effects.
steps.content: Use the name tag on other mobs for other fun effects. There are a few other Easter eggs in Minecraft that use the name tag. Add the following name tags on certain animals and villagers to create fun effects, like: [14] X Research source “Dinnerbone” or “Grumm” turns a mob upside down. This works on all animals and villagers except the ender dragon and squid. “Toast” gives a rabbit black and white spots. This effect was created after a user asked Minecraft developer Ryan Holtz to make a rabbit that looked like his lost bunny named Toast. This only works on rabbits. “Johnny” causes a vindicator to attack all other mobs except evokers, pillagers, vindicators, and ghasts. This only works on vindicators.

steps.title: Does “jeb_” work on Bedrock?
steps.content: Does “jeb_” work on Bedrock? Yes, “jeb_” should work on Minecraft Bedrock. If your sheep isn’t turning rainbow colors, double check that “jeb” is in all lowercase letters and that there is an underscore (“_”) after “jeb”. Make sure your game is updated to the latest version, too. [15] X Research source Previously, there have been issues with “jeb_” working on Realms in Bedrock. So, it’s possible that this is still an issue for some people. The “jeb_” Easter egg should work on all platforms and editions, including PC, Xbox, Nintendo, PS4/5, and Java, and modes, including Survival and Creative.

steps.title: Does “jeb_” work on any animal?
steps.content: Does “jeb_” work on any animal? No, “jeb_” only turns sheep rainbow colors. This Easter egg does not work on any other animals or villagers.

steps.title: How can I get different colored sheep in Minecraft?
steps.content: How can I get different colored sheep in Minecraft? Use dyes to get different colored sheep. There are 16 different colored dyes you can make, which you typically craft from different colored flowers and plants. [16] X Research source Once you have a dye made, simply hold it and click a sheep to change its wool color. [17] X Research source When you shear a dyed sheep, its wool will be the same color as the dye.
